title: Towers are suppose to be a staple of this game
body:
Yet Riot is doing everything they can to make them as good as wooden towers in Age Of Empires.

I think there needs to be a massive over hall of the towers and how the towers work.

Towers are suppose to be the gate keepers of the base, with increasing difficulty as you get closer and closer to the nexus, however, one super minion wave can take down 1 and a 1/4 Nexus turrets. It shouldn't be like that at all.

And yeah, the "Protective shield" that towers get for the first 5 or 10 minutes is worthless and does nothing for the towers.

replies.body:
Increasing difficulty?

Towers do not scale later into the game. It is your job to protect them later. So having them becoming more difficult to take as you get closer to the nexus would defeat the purpose of needing to protect them late game.

Agreed. I could be convinced that they need to have a little more scaling armor pen so that the Maokai's and Sejuani's of the world can't just nap under enemy turrets, but the threat of a tower shot is pretty prevalent to any squishy at all points in the game. Frankly, if you're losing a tower in the first five minutes of solo queue you likely screwed up big time in lane or your team should be matching that pressure elsewhere. No super minion wave should be taking 1.25 nexus turrets uncontested, and if that's the case the enemy team is doing a good job splitting your attention. That or your team is doing something really bad.

A level 11 Teemo can take 6 tower shots, with Liandries as his only defensive item. At that level with that item he's only got roughly 1.1 k health. No, a tower shot is not prevalent at all stages of the game. They stop mattering real quick.

The real problem is that Riot won't implement the systems/items necessary to properly defend paper towers. They want players to push back waves and fight off champion push attempts, but we have no quick way to do that. By the time you're able to rotate around to effectively fend off someone pushing a lane, a coordinated team is already moving to siege other less-defended towers.

If Riot would put things like Dota's TP scrolls or Boots of Travel, even in a limited way, there would actually be a reason for the Towers to be as flimsy as they are. Plus, a positive to this that it would allow split-push teams the sort of counterplay they need to exist in a healthy manner. Maybe that's why we don't have this capability, since Riot only seems interested in promoting 5-man fights down Mid lane.

I could see the argument for an overhaul of how towers work, but not in the way you mean. 

I could, separately, see an argument for adding a timed-duration bonus to the damage of inner towers or higher. For example, until X minutes, Inner turrets gain +25 bonus (base, and therefore increased by heating up mechanic) damage to champions, until X+Y minutes, Inhibitor turrets gain +50 bonus damage to champions, and until X+Y+Z minutes, Nexus turrets gain +75 bonus damage to champions. Numbers fudged, could be a larger or smaller amount. The idea being that in the case of extreme snowballs, people still can't just get COMPLETELY dumpstered under double nexus turrets at 15 minutes.

I could also see an argument for inhib or nexus turrets to get some amount of % HP damage OR additional % armor pen to better deal with tanks latter into the game. This would need to be compensated for, though, as 'real' squishies do die quickly enough to towers already. You'll see tanks that can just take like 50+ tower shots end game right now, and that's a little over the top. The towers should still matter *eventually*.

Would be a fun issue is if you can buy an Item like GP's Ult or Backstreet Brawler game mode(IDK if that is the name of it). You can buy 3 different items One item increases that towers Attack/Armor,HP/Health regen on the tower. Hell Nasus at a point will eventually 4 shot a Tower with his Q that is on a 2 second CD. Isn't the reason they got rid of Crits against towers because Yasuo/Trynd/Yi made towers non-existent.
Only fix I'd give is to make it so when towers are focusing a champion, they focus the one with the lowest health. Makes it so it's harder to get ganged up on by your laner and the jungler.

This super-early meta gets on my nerves.
